title: Email Marketing Manager
description:
Gpac (Growing People & Companies, www.gogpac.com) has been retained by a New York, Rockland County nonprofit organization to search for an Email Marketing Manager who will report directly to the Executive Director. This organization empowers people living with serious and sometimes life-long chronic illnesses. They promote evidenced-based education and tools to help people make informed medical decisions and by advocating for improved access to health care.

The culture at the organization promotes healthy living and lifestyles. The organization is very diverse and is open to candidates from all backgrounds. Candidates who are ex-military are encouraged to apply.

The Email Marketing Manager Will

Work with members of all departments (education, research, advocacy) to engage their audience of people living with chronic disease, contributing to overarching business strategies and decisions.Develop and execute email marketing campaigns, updating automated email series, and cross promote various email lists.Utilize the email marketing software, Mailchimp, to manage all email campaigns from inception to execution organization wide. This includes participating in drafting of engaging content and formatting emails that align with mission and message.

Requirements And Responsibilities

Marketing and Communications Background: A degree or experience in marketing, communications, or a related field is desired to grasp audience engagement and effective messaging and branding.

Experience with Email Marketing Platforms: Proficiency in using email marketing platforms such as Mailchimp, Constant Contact, or similar tools is essential for creating and distributing newsletters, managing subscriber lists, and analyzing campaign performance.

Content Creation and Copywriting Skills: Must have good writing skills for crafting email content that captures the audience's interest, with an emphasis on creating compelling subject lines and clear, informative messages.

Strategic Marketing: An understanding of how to craft marketing strategies tailored to different stages of the patient journey. The role requires the ability to analyze and segment the audience effectively, creating personalized and dynamic campaigns that address the specific needs, concerns, and motivations at each stage of their journey.

Graphic Design Abilities: While not mandatory, basic skills in graphic design software like Adobe, Photoshop or Canva can be valuable for creating visually appealing newsletter layouts and branded imagery.

Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Should be comfortable with basic data monitoring related to email marketing, such as monitoring open rates and click-through rates, and able to learn how to compile these insights for reports and email strategy.

List Management: Knowledge of list management best practices is essential for targeting specific patient demographics with relevant content and promotions.

Organizational Skills: The ability to manage various tasks simultaneously, adhere to deadlines, and coordinate with various stakeholders (designers, writers, IT professionals, etc.) is crucial for successful newsletter campaigns.

Adaptability and Creativity: The digital marketing landscape is constantly evolving, so candidates should be adaptable to new trends, technologies, and best practices. Creativity is also valuable for brainstorming innovative newsletter ideas and campaigns.

Email Compliance Knowledge: Knowledge of email compliance regulations such as CAN-SPAM, GDPR, CPRA, and CCPA is preferred though not mandatory.

Remote Work Proficiency: Demonstrated capability to effectively work remotely, including strong communication skills, self-motivation, and proficiency in utilizing remote collaboration tools.

Anticipated Salary Range: $65,000 - $80,000 per year, based on experience.

Employment will be on a contract basis for the first 4 months, with the opportunity to stay on as a full-time employee based on organizational need and fit at the end of the 4-month period. 

Applicants should submit a cover letter detailing their experience with the requirements above, particularly strategic marketing and experience with email campaigns. Please send the cover letter and your resume confidentially to carol.sieger@gpac.com. If you have any questions, Carol can also be reached at 605.799.8136.

Hilco Streambank is a preeminent intellectual property advisory firm. Our advisory team specializes in advisory services related to all forms of intangible assets, including brands, software, patent portfolios and supporting technology. In connection with these assets, we provide sell-side, buy-side, advisory and valuation services.

We are seeking an analyst to assist in sell-side, buy-side and advisory services. The person filling this role would supplement the efforts of and collaborate closely with our current analyst, to assist in managing an increasingly larger workflow.

What We Do

By way of example: when a retailer files for bankruptcy and announces it is going out of business, the company sells the assets in the stores (apparel, furniture, etc.). The retailer’s brand name, e-commerce platform, domain names and other intangible assets have value and can also be sold.

Hilco Streambank serves as an agent that sells those intangible assets, whether because a company is going out of business or whether it simply seeks to divest itself of non-core assets. We develop processes to market these intangible assets, similar to the way in which investment banks run processes to market entire companies, but often on a much more compressed time frame and involving creatively implemented auction structures. We have conducted processes to sell assets including patents protecting technology related to augmented reality glasses, historic photography archives, department store nameplates and other retail brands and digital media publisher assets.

When we are not engaged as the agent to market the intangible assets for sale, we often advise lenders with interests in those assets.

Separate from our sell-side advisory roles, we also assist clients in evaluating patent portfolios and provide advisory services related to patents including identifying white space (research and development opportunities), acquiring patents and other intangible assets, and identifying monetizable patents.

What You Would Do

The analyst will support the team with all activities related to our advisory services, such as identifying potential targets who may have an interest in the particular assets we are marketing, drafting content for marketing collateral including teasers and brand books, working with clients to assemble diligence materials, conducting outreach efforts, drafting client-facing reports, participating in auctions and assisting in transaction closings. The candidate should be able to work on multiple projects and transactions at a given time.

The analyst will have the opportunity to interface with clients and potential buyers of a client’s assets, so good interpersonal skills are a must.

The Vice President of Public Credit Tax will work with the Head of Tax Reporting – will lead and oversee all strategic tax planning, preparation and review of the tax provisions (including excise taxes), and tax and information reporting for our public credit funds that are regulated investment companies (“RIC”). ARCC holds several equity positions in blocker corporations.

This position is responsible for assisting with all tax matters across the various public credit funds that are primarily taxed as RICs.
